results.question: What are the variations in playing MONOPOLY with the Speed Die?

MONOPOLY 
Property Trading Game from Parker Brothers" 
AGES 8+ 
2 to 8 Players 
Contents: Gameboard, 3 dice, tokens, 32 houses, I2 hotels, Chance

read the section below for the additional Speed Die rules.
results.predicted:
According to the context, there are two main rules that affect when players can start using the Speed Die:

1. The game starts with each player receiving $1,000 (two $500 bills) as extra cash.
2. Players cannot use the Speed Die until they have landed on or passed over "GO" for the first time and collected their initial $200 salary.

Once these conditions are met, players can start using the Speed Die, which is rolled along with the two white dice on each turn. The result of the Speed Die determines how many spaces to move:

* If the Speed Die shows 1, 2, or 3, add this number to the roll of the two white dice.

results.question: What is the condition under which a player can purchase an unowned property from the Bank?
results.ground_truth:
BUYING PROPERTY: Whenever you land on an unowned property you 
may buy that property from the Bank at its printed price. You receive the 
Title Deed card showing ownership; place it faceup in front of you. If you do not wish to buy the property, the Banker sells it at auction 
to the highest bidder. The buyer pays the Bank the amount of the bid 
in cash and receives the Title Deed card for that property. Any player, 
including the one who declined the option to buy it at the printed 
price, may bid. Bidding may start at any price.

results.question: What are the benefits of holding all Title Deed cards for a specific color group?
results.ground_truth:
PAMNG 
When you land on property owned by another player, 
the owner collects rent from you in accordance with the list printed on 
its Title Deed card. If the property is mortgaged, no rent can be collected. When a 
property is mortgaged, its Title Deed card is placed facedown in front 
of the owner. L 
It is an advantage to hold all the Title Deed cards in a color- 
group (e.g., Boardwalk and Park Place; or Connecticut, Vermont and 
Oriental Avenues) because the owner may then charge double rent 
for unimproved properties in that color-group.

results.question: What are the four possible ways to get out of jail?
results.ground_truth:
You get out of Jail by.. . (I) throwing doubles on any of your next 
three turns; if you succeed in doing this you immediately move forward 
the number of spaces shown by your doubles throw; even though you 
had thrown doubles, you do not take another turn; (2) using the "Get 
Out of Jail Free" card if you have it; (3) purchasing the "Get Out of Jail 
Free" card from another player and playing it; (4) paying a fine of $50 
before you roll the dice on either of your next two turns. If you do not throw doubles by your third turn, you must pay the $50 
fine.

results.question: What is the condition for a mortgage to be granted on an improved property?
results.ground_truth:
Houses and hotels may be sold back to the Bank at any time for one- 
half the price paid for them. All houses on one color-group must be sold one by one, evenly, in

sold one house at a time (one hotel equals five houses), evenly, in 
reverse of the manner in which they were erected. MORTGAGES: Unimproved properties can be mortgaged through the 
Bank at any time. Before an improved property can be mortgaged, all 
the buildings on all the properties of its color-group must be sold back 
to the Bank at half price.

back houses at full price. The player who mortgages property retains possession of it and 
no other player may secure it by lifting the mortgage from the Bank.
